diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Metastatic breast cancer, Stage 2 sacral decubitus, Post-op low urine output
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's history of recurrent right upper abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, along with the presence of tenderness in the abdominal area, supported the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis. Additional concern for her underlying metastatic breast cancer and other conditions was acknowledged.
